page.title: 08Industry in Bridport
page.content: Bridport's traditonal rope and net making industry is now almost entirely sited in the northern half of the town outside this survey area. The oldest industry in the southern half of Bridport is Palmer's Brewery which stands on the site of an old mill dating back to 1794. The Brewery today serves about seventy Palmer's Houses in Bridport and West Dorset. It produces traditionally brewed draught and bottled beers. The main trading estate is named St. Michael's. It contains many small businesses including D-I-Y, a tyre company, a carpenter's workshop, a printing works, warehouses, etc. To the west is the newer Dreadnought trading estate which also contains a number of small businesses including a wholesale fruit market, a car repairers, engraving works, etc.
